availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Elliott (Bracken County, Kentucky, butcher, tavern keeper, and hotel keeper)

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, butcher, tavern keeper, and hotel keeper. Kentucky native. Married to Etna Wells Elliot in Bracken County, Kentucky, on October 5, 1847. Father of Alice Elliot, Mary A. Elliot, Ada Elliot, Catherine Elliot, Elijah Elliot, and John Elliot. Butcher in Bracken County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Bracken County in 1850. Tavern keeper in Bracken County in 1860. Butcher in Bracken County in 1863. Hotel keeper in Bracken County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, p. 447A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, p. 647.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Germantown, p. 125.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Germantown, p. 371A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bracken County Marriages, Film 000344097.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Bracken County, KY, June-July 1863, p. 73.
"John W. Elliot (1824-1886)," Find A Grave, Memorial 102765504, accessed December 28, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/102765504.
